title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
description: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

items.content_html:
Jenkins Sametime Plugin stores credentials unencrypted in its global configuration file hudson.plugins.sametime.im.transport.SametimePublisher.xml on the Jenkins controller. These credentials can be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10297
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-03/#SECURITY-1090
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/12/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jvr5-r663-qxgw
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:sametime] Jenkins Sametime Plugin stores credentials in plain text

items.content_html:
Jenkins youtrack-plugin Plugin stored credentials unencrypted in its global configuration file org.jenkinsci.plugins.youtrack.YouTrackProjectProperty.xml on the Jenkins controller. These credentials could be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system.

youtrack-plugin Plugin now stores credentials encrypted.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10287
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-03/#SECURITY-963
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/12/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c7p6-x2p3-3wph
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:youtrack-plugin] Jenkins youtrack-plugin Plugin stored credentials in plain text

items.content_html:
Jenkins Diawi Upload Plugin stores credentials unencrypted in job config.xml files on the Jenkins controller. These credentials can be viewed by users with Extended Read permission, or access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10284
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-03/#SECURITY-947
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/12/2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-ph9f-h462-j5jg
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:diawi-upload] Jenkins Diawi Upload Plugin stores credentials in plain text

items.content_html:
The f:validateButton form control for the Jenkins UI did not properly escape job URLs in Jenkins 2.171 and earlier and Jenkins LTS 2.164.1 and earlier, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by users with the ability to control job names.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1003050
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:1605
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-10/#SECURITY-1327
  • https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2022.html
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107889
  • https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/commit/8eb632dda219ec8796420ce58d9564cddf8f8f93
  • https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/commit/d393c7e9ba3ec44953ef1f8b11839421e2649ee7
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qpg9-83fv-x9ch
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.main:jenkins-core] Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation in Jenkins

The f:validateButton form control for the Jenkins UI did not properly escape job URLs in Jenkins 2.171 and earlier and Jenkins LTS 2.164.1 and earlier, resulting in a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exploitable by users with the ability to control job names.

items.content_html:
Jenkins jira-ext Plugin 0.8 and earlier stored credentials unencrypted in its global configuration file hudson.plugins.jira.JiraProjectProperty.xml on the Jenkins master. These credentials could be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins master file system.

jira-ext Plugin version 0.9 stores credentials encrypted.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10302
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-17/#SECURITY-836
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108045
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-chm8-wp3h-f4m3
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:jira-ext] Jenkins jira-ext Plugin stores credentials unencrypted

items.content_html:
Jenkins Relution Enterprise Appstore Publisher Plugin stores credentials unencrypted in its global configuration file org.jenkinsci.plugins.relution_publisher.configuration.global.StoreConfiguration.xml on the Jenkins controller. These credentials can be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10281
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-03/#SECURITY-828
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/12/2

items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:relution-publisher] Jenkins Relution Enterprise Appstore Publisher Plugin stores credentials in plain text

items.content_html:
Jenkins Slack Notification Plugin did not perform permission checks on a method implementing form validation. This allowed users with Overall/Read access to Jenkins to connect to an attacker-specified URL using attacker-specified credentials IDs obtained through another method, capturing credentials stored in Jenkins.

Additionally, this form validation method did not require POST requests, resulting in a cross-site request forgery vulnerability.

This form validation method now requires POST requests and Overall/Administer (for global configuration) or Item/Configure permissions (for job configuration).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1003043
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-03-25/#SECURITY-976
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/03/28/2
  • https://github.com/jenkinsci/slack-plugin/commit/0268bbefdcc283effd27be5318770f7e75c6f102
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200227082607/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107628
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-22xp-7rcx-xp34
items.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:slack] Jenkins Slack Notification Plugin missing permission check

items.content_html:
Jenkins PRQA Plugin stored a password unencrypted in its global configuration file on the Jenkins controller. This password could be viewed by users with access to the Jenkins controller file system.

The plugin now stores the password encrypted in the configuration files on disk.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-1003048
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-03-25/#SECURITY-1089
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/03/28/2
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200227082607/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/107628
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mxmw-6qgj-h67x
items.title: [com.programmingresearch:prqa-plugin] Jenkins PRQA Plugin stored password in plain text
